body_content.explanation: using as much effort, as many different methods, etc. as possible in order to achieve something:
examples: We made an all-out effort to get the project finished on time.
The army launched an all-out assault on the city.
The supermarket seems to be embarking on an all out campaign to win customers from rivals.

body_content.explanation: In cricket, a team is all out when it is no longer able to keep batting (= trying to hit the ball and score) because all of its players have had their turn:
examples: England were all out for a mere 42 runs.
An all-out total of 307 meant victory for the West Indies by 134 runs.

body_content.explanation: in a way that uses as much effort, as many different methods, etc. as possible in order to achieve something:
examples: My family really goes all out at Christmas, decorating the entire house inside and out and buying mountains of gifts.
The police were working all-out to find the culprit.

body_content.explanation: at the time when a cricket team is no longer able to keep batting (= trying to hit the ball and score) because all of its players have had their turn:
examples: The home side collapsed to 169 all out.
